docs.snippet: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump lashed out at U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan and other "disloyal" Republicans on Tuesday and vowed to campaign in whatever style he wants now that the party establishment has largely abandoned him....
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump lashed out at U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan and other "disloyal" Republicans on Tuesday and vowed to campaign in whatever style he wants now that the party establishment has largely abandoned him.

headline.main: Trump Assails House Speaker Ryan, McCain as 'Disloyal'
headline.print_headline: Trump Assails House Speaker Ryan, McCain as 'Disloyal'

docs.snippet: The "shackles" gone, Donald Trump stepped up his fierce attacks on his own party leaders Tuesday, promising to teach Republicans who oppose him a lesson and fight for the presidency "the way I want to."...

headline.main: Unshackled, Trump Unleashes Aggressive Attacks on Own Party

docs.snippet: A longtime political adviser to Hillary Clinton last year urged her presidential campaign to support a new version of a law that separated commercial and investment banking to avoid antagonizing the Democratic Party's progressive wing, according t...
docs.lead_paragraph: A longtime political adviser to Hillary Clinton last year urged her presidential campaign to support a new version of a law that separated commercial and investment banking to avoid antagonizing the Democratic Party's progressive wing, according to emails published by Wikileaks on Monday.

headline.main: Clinton Weighed Reinstating Glass-Steagall, Wikileaks Emails Show
headline.print_headline: Clinton Weighed Reinstating Glass-Steagall, Wikileaks Emails Show

docs.snippet: Democrats trying to retake the House and Senate see new opportunity from the tape of Donald Trump talking about women in crude, predatory terms. The footage has already prompted ads in at least four House races as well as the hard-fought New Hamps...
docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats trying to retake the House and Senate see new opportunity from the tape of Donald Trump talking about women in crude, predatory terms. The footage has already prompted ads in at least four House races as well as the hard-fought New Hampshire Senate contest, and may be giving new life to Democratic efforts to tie Republican candidates to the GOP presidential nominee.

headline.main: Senate, House Dems See New Opportunity From Trump Tapes
headline.print_headline: Senate, House Dems See New Opportunity From Trump Tapes

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton's campaign was worried about the "hard balance" she would need to strike as the presidential candidate prepared to oppose a Pacific trade pact championed by President Barack Obama that she once supported, according to emails publis...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton's campaign was worried about the "hard balance" she would need to strike as the presidential candidate prepared to oppose a Pacific trade pact championed by President Barack Obama that she once supported, according to emails published on Tuesday by WikiLeaks.

headline.main: Clinton Opposition to Asia Trade Pact 'Close Call': Hacked Emails
headline.print_headline: Clinton Opposition to Asia Trade Pact 'Close Call': Hacked Emails

docs.snippet: Hacked emails show that Hillary Clinton's campaign was slow to grasp the seriousness of the controversy over her use of a homebrew email server and believed it might blow over after one weekend....
